conversation_summary: Parents’ garage, 1987: wood-paneled stereo breathes vacuum-blue light, volume knob at 11. Copper wires pulse like arteries; parents’ faces flick skin-to-monitor. Sub-rattled concrete splits, vomiting circuitry. Inside the sunrise, CCTV rays drip muzak jazz that swallows runners whole; ghost-piano skips echo off steel reset-booth waiting at the mall’s end.
